Welcome to FastAPI’s documentation!¶

Fast API main¶

main.read_root()¶

The read_root function returns a dictionary with the key ‘message’ and value ‘Hello’.

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

Fast API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactRequest, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes a ContactRequest object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The function then checks if the phone number already exists for that user, and returns an error if it does. If not, it adds the contact to the database and returns it.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactRequest: Specify the type of data that is expected in the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the jwt token

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Type[Contact]¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. db (Session): A connection to the database. user (User): The user who is making this request, used for authorization purposes.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to delete

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token and use it to filter contacts

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Type[Contact]¶

The get_contact function takes a contact_id and returns the corresponding Contact object. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path parameter

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to access this contact

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session, user: User) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first x number of contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user’s contacts

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(body: str, skip: int, limit: int, db: Session, user: User) → list[Type[Contact]]¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

body (str): The search query string. skip (int): Number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0. limit (int): Maximum number of records to return. Default is 100, upper limit is 1000, lower limit is 1.

Parameters:

  • body – str: Search the database for contacts that match

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the list

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, user: User) → list[Type[Contact]]¶
The upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next seven days.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for querying. user (User): The user who’s contacts we want to query for upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, updated_contact: ContactRequest, db: Session, user: User) → Type[Contact]¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • updated_contact – ContactRequest: Pass in the updated contact information

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the contact

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

Fast API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Validate the data that is passed into the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The first user in the database that matches the email provided

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Update the avatar url of a user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

Fast API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactRequest, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactRequest: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts from the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

The list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(body: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The search_contacts function is used to search for contacts in the database. It takes a string as an argument and searches for it in the name, last name or email fields of all contacts. The function returns a list of contact objects that match the query.

Parameters:

  • body – str: Search for contacts by name, last name or email

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays. The function takes in the database session and the current user as parameters, and uses them to call the repository_contacts.upcoming_birthdays function.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactRequest, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactRequest object containing the new information for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing contact to be updated.

  • db (optional): A Session object used to connect to and query a database, if not provided, one will be created automatically using get_db().

Parameters:

  • body – ContactRequest: Specify the type of data that will be passed in the request body

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

user – User: Specify the type of object that will be passed to the function

Returns:

The current user object

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A user object

Fast API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database and if they have already confirmed their email. If not, then we update their record in our database with a confirmation of their email.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dict with the access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token pair. The function first decodes the given refresh token to get the email of its owner. Then it gets that user from our database and checks if their stored refresh_token matches with what was passed in as an argument (if not, we raise an error). If everything checks out, we create new tokens for this user using auth0’s create functions.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an asynchronous task (using FastAPI’s BackgroundTasks) to send_email(), passing in the user’s email, username and base url.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The function also takes an instance of BackgroundTasks and Request from FastAPI, which are used to send an email to the user after they sign up.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the website

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the user and a detail message

Doc-author:

Trelent

Fast API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 60 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s id,

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token in the form of a byte string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who has a valid refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, otherwise it raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed into the function

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • plain_password – Compare the password that is entered by the user to verify if it matches with the hashed_password

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is hashed

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

Fast API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that users can click on within their emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent
